    • Method Detail

      • pixelGap

        public static double pixelGap(double zoom)
        Counts the area of complex values that each pixel covers.
        Parameters:
        zoom - Value that defines how much picture is zoomed.
        Returns:
        Longest distance between two complex-numbers that pixel covers.

      • windowCordinateSystemLimits

        public static double[] windowCordinateSystemLimits(Complex_Number center,
                                   double pixelGap,
                                   int width,
                                   int heigth)
        Counts biggest imaginary value and smallest real value that can be seen on the screen.
        Parameters:
        center - Complex-number that is at the center of the screen.
        pixelGap - Biggest difference between two complex-number that any pixel presents.
        width - Width of the screen in pixels.
        heigth - Height of the screen in pixels.
        Returns:
        Array that contains real-axel min value (index 0) and imaginary-axel max value (index 1).

      • pixel

        public static Complex_Number pixel(Complex_Number center,
                   double zoom,
                   int pixelX,
                   int pixelY,
                   int heigth,
                   int width)
        Forms complex-number that corresponds given pixel coordinates.
        Parameters:
        center - Complex-number that is at the center of the screen.
        zoom - Value that defines how much picture is zoomed.
        pixelX - x-coordinate of the pixel.
        pixelY - y-coordinate of the pixel.
        heigth - Height of the screen in pixels.
        width - Width of the screen in pixels.
        Returns:
        Complex-number corresponding given pixel coordinates.
